question:
You are a math expert. When you respond, respond only with the Solution of the final Problem, thinking step by step. At the end of the Solution, when you give your final answer, write it in the form 'Final Answer: \\boxed{$answer$}. I hope it is correct.'
Here are two functions: $$\begin{array}{ccc}
f(x) & = & 3x^2-2x+ 4\\
g(x) & = & x^2-kx-6
\end{array}$$ If $f(10) - g(10) = 10,$ what is the value of $k?$
ground_truth: We have that \begin{align*} f(x) - g(x) &= (3x^2-2x+ 4) - (x^2-kx-6) \\ &= 2x^2 + (k-2)\cdot x +10. \end{align*}So $f(10) - g(10) = 2\cdot 10^2 + (k - 2)\cdot 10 +10 = 10.$ Thus $-2\cdot 10^2 = (k-2)\cdot 10,$ and $k = \boxed{-18}.$

question:
Substitute $x=10$ into the functions.

$$f(10) - g(10) = (3\cdot10^2-2\cdot10+4) - (10^2-k\cdot10-6) = 10$$

$$3\cdot100-20+4-100+10k+6=10$$

$$280-76+10k=10$$

$$204+10k = 10$$

$$10k = -194$$

$$k = \boxed{-19.4}.$$
Final Answer: $\boxed{-19.4}.$ I hope it is correct.
